content.description: Start on the shoulder-high sloper on the right side of the boulder, move your way left on a good side pull and thumbdercling to a nice jug on the left side, then go for the top. Pretty easy top out.
content.location: Follow the main dirt trail for about a quarter mile from the split with the paved bike trail, then head off towards the river on a side trail. Boulder is pretty far set back from the river and climb is on the south side of the boulder.

content.description: Starts at the bottom and traverses up and left to the top. The crux is about 20 feet high where the handhold options decrease, but there is a really solid mono along one of the cracks where you can dig in and get a high left foot to pull out of it. There is some vegetation but nothing too bad or in the way.
content.protection:
Could set up a top rope with trad gear. A couple hexes and a cam would work.

We Deep water solo'd it since it is above the river and is a known cliff jumping spot. (super fun)
content.location:
**what we did

Set up an anchor system on the bolts on the lower rock and rappel down. Unclip and traverse over and up.

climbs.name: "Danger" Slab
climbs.fa: The ghost of the architect of Folsom Prison?

content.description: If you're there with alone with climbing shoes, no reason not to balance, mantel, downclimb and traverse for a workout. Rock is - no surprise - river polished - but dries faster and has better friction than most other rock in the area.
content.location: Rainbow Bridge side of the rock with the anchors at the top.
